Authors:
Terry D MACFARLANE, Galina Viktorovna Degtjareva, Tahir H
Samigullin, Carmen M Valiejo-Roman, Konstantin I FOMICHEV, Dmitry D
Sokoloff
Title:
Althenia tzvelevii (Potamogetonaceae), a new species from SW
Western Australia with bilocular anthers: morphology and molecular
phylogenetic relationships
Abstract:
A new species Althenia tzvelevii is described from south
western Australia. This is the second species after A. bilocularis
described with bilocular anthers. Illustrations of plant morphology are
provided by means of SEM images and habitat photographs are included.
The phylogenetic relationships of the new species were investigated
using five plastid DNA markers (matK, ndhF, rbcL, rpoB, and rpoC1), with
published sequences augmented by several new sequences resulting in
coverage of all described species in the genus. Althenia tzvelevii forms
a clade with A. patentifolia and A. bilocularis and other relationships
within the genus are clarified.
